main.name: Konrad Guzior
main.description: with his head up in the clouds.
main.bio: My name is Konrad and I'm a Full Stack JavaScript Developer at <Salt/>. I'm a problem solver and I love puzzles, I think that is one of the reasons why I like programming so much. I see the development process as one big puzzle... A puzzle that you create and solve by yourself.
main.bio2: I spend most of my free time at my flightclub. I've been flying gliders and small airplanes since I was 17 and I just can't get enough of it.
main.contactmessage: Get in touch with me to receive further details.

work.title: Full stack Javascript developer
work.description: Working as a consultant for a company with worlds toughest bootcamp.

work.title: Flight instructor
work.description: Showing the world from up above to people in a two seated aircraft.

work.title: It-specialist / salesman – TCM Tyresö Cykelmagasin
work.description: From a mechanic through a salesman to being in charge of our e-commerce site.

projects.title: <SaltChat/>
projects.description: Chat application! The requirements for this project were quite challenging. I had to learn new technologies in order to complete it, but in the end, I can say I'm proud of what I have got. I was asked to write a chat application in TypeScript using react. All to say that by the end of the project I became a much more confident developer than I was before. Try it out, maybe this will become the next messenger?

projects.title: Wastr
projects.description: First real project! The assignment for our graduation project was to build something that makes society better in some way. We also got the requirement to use GraphQL. We came up with the app Wastr, an app that lets you keep track of the amount of trash you are producing which hopefully saves the environment! This project was really exciting for our group since we were only two people so we had to learn to manage the time we had.

projects.title: Let the man hang
projects.description: My second humble, little project. Hangman you can play on your terminal. In early 2020 when I got the news that I got into <salt/> I knew that for a long time now I would mostly be working in javascript. That's why I spent one-week learning the basics of c#. After a week not only did I have a pretty decent and simple game to play but also... I fell in love with c#. I really enjoyed object-oriented programming and I'm sure I will come back to it one day.

projects.title: Glideit
projects.description: This is the very first project I have ever made. One week after I started to learn javascript I remembered one good idea for a game I had and I started to build it. I had no idea what I was doing back then but hey, it worked! Even though this is a very simple game I'm still proud of it and play it from time to time. Maybe one day I will make a better version of it? This game is a very simple cross country gliding simulator; gather height under clouds, fly towards turn point on the right and try to get back home. Hope you enjoy it!

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Sonny Sangha must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
